alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Lexington; Newberry; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Fairfield, southeastern Newberry, central Lexington and northwestern Richland Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Red Bank, moving northeast at 40 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, Dentsville, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Jenkinsville, Harbison State Forest, SC State Fair Grounds and West Columbia Riverwalk. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 42 and 72. Interstate 26 between mile markers 86 and 116. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
